intro: Sesleria argentea subsp. gomarica, commonly known as silver grass, is a perennial grass native to southern Europe. It features narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a silvery or grayish bloom, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, pale green or white flowers in dense spikes during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sesleria argentea subsp. gomarica is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
